p: Of the seven coronavirus species that infect humans, three are zoonotic and have been linked to epidemics. However, unlike its two predecessors (SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV), SARS-CoV-2 is more contagious, with a higher speed of transmission, but a lower case fatality rate (currently 3.1%) [ 1- 3]. As of May 22, 2020, a total of 5 121 639 infected people and 333 382 deaths have been registered worldwide. To date, there is no specific vaccine or treatment.
